frameDefinitions: An Agent has done or omitted to do an Act or is responsible for the obtaining of a State_of_affairs, which a Judge deems to constitute a violation of an obligation or a moral guideline.
These are words relating to filling containers and covering areas with some thing, things or substance, the Theme.
A Sender plans the Path (along with Source and Goal) of a Theme and places it in circumstances such that it travels along this Path under the power of some entity other than the Sender.
A Judge refrains from imposing, or demanding a punishment for an Evaluee who has committed an Offense.
Generally without overall (translational) motion,  an Agent places a Theme at a location, the Goal, which is profiled.
An Agent manipulates a Fastener to open or close a Containing_object (e.g. coat, jar).
frameExamples: Kim failed to fully <t>justify</t> his decision.
Lionel Hutz <t>coated</t> the wall with paint.
I <t>sent</t> the manuscript to England to Bill.
David <t>placed</t> his briefcase on the floor.
Mary <t>closed</t> her coat with a belt.
listRoleDefinitions: The person or organization that  is held responsible for a prior <fen>Act</fen> or for a <fen>State_of_affairs</fen>.
An action  for which the <fen>Agent</fen> is held responsible, frequently one that the <fen>Agent</fen> has taken themself.
A <fen>State_of_affairs</fen> that the Agent is held responsible for.
The <fen>Time</fen> of the justifying event.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the actor who instigates the filling.
The <fen>Theme</fen> is the physical object or substance which changes location.
The <fen>Goal</fen> is the area or container being filled. Goal is generally the NP Object in this frame.
An event which brings about the filling of the <fen>Goal</fen>.
When the filling occurs.
Where the filling takes place.
This is the person who initiates the movement of the <fen>Theme</fen> and, unlike Carrying, does not accompany it.

The end of the path and intended goal of the sending.
I <t>sent</t> the logs <fex name='Goal'>to the shed</fex>.

The objects being sent.
I mailed <fex name='Theme'>the books</fex> <fex name='Goal'>to Alaska</fex>.
Note that <fen>Theme</fen> may be multiply instantiated.
They <t>mailed</t><fex name='Theme'>a questionnaire</fex> <fex name='Theme'>with a return envelope</fex>.

The mode of sending employed.
I <t>shipped</t> <fex name='Theme'>the crops</fex> <fex name='Transport_means'>by bigrig </fex>.

This is the recipient of the sent <fen>Theme</fen>.
<fex name='Sender'>Tess</fex> <t>mailed</t> <fex name='Theme'>a letter</fex> <fex name='Recipient'> to Abby</fex>
When the sending takes place
A spatial setting encomnpassing the Source location, where the Sending event takes place.
The <fen>Judge</fen> holds the <fen>Evaluee</fen> responsible for the <fen>Offense</fen>.
The <fen>Evaluee</fen> is subject to the judgment of the <fen>Judge</fen> for having committed the <fen>Offense</fen>.
The <fen>Offense</fen> is the illicit or unpleasant act committed by the <fen>Evaluee</fen>.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the person (or other force) that causes the <fen>Theme</fen> to move.
The <fen>Theme</fen> is the object that changes location during the Placing.
The role <fen>Goal</fen> is the location where the <fen>Theme</fen> ends up. This role is profiled by words in this frame.
<fen>Time</fen> is when the Placing occurs
The <fen>Place</fen> indicates where the Placing occurs.

This role identifies the item that is closed by the agent with the fastener.
<fex name='Agent'>Lee</fex> <t>buttoned</t> <fex name='Containing_object'>his coat</fex>.
The Agent opens/closes the Containing-object.
This role identifies the fastener that the agent manipulates.
This role identifies the active zone of the container that may be expressed as the direct object of the target verb.
The time at which the <fen>Agent</fen> closes the <fen>Container_portal</fen> or the <fen>Containing_object</fen>.
The location where the closing event takes place.
listRoleExamples: <fex>Smithers</fex> defended his decision by insisting that he had used his best judgment
Kim failed  to fully justify <fex>his decision</fex>.
The lawyers tried  to justify <fex>enormous punitive damages being paid to victims on a first-past-the-post system</fex> .
Rev. Lovejoy carefully brushed the rolls <fex>with butter</fex>.
I sent the letter to you <fex>last week</fex>.
Barney posted the letter on Monday <fex>in Athens</fex>
Won't you forgive me <fex>for keeping it a secret</fex>?
<fex>The waiter</fex> placed the food on the table.
The waiter placed <fex>the food</fex> on the table.
The waiter placed the food <fex>on the table</fex>.
Grass , which is sown with clover , provides rich pasture for cattle in summer and the clover is <fex>another plant which</fex> puts nitrogen into the soil .
Smithers had placed the table there <fex>the night before</fex>.
Marcus tied his shoe <fex>with the neon-green shoelaces</fex>.
They close the bank vault <fex>at precisely 5:35PM</fex>.
Shouldn't you have buttoned that <fex>in the bathroom</fex>?
